original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.44. Ajjhattattika, Hetuduka🔽Ajjhattaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nabahiddhā nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Bahiddhā
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi         ajjhattam hetum dhammam paṭicca na bahiddhā na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā bahiddhā
translated: (The Triad of the Conditions)🔽With internal condition as condition, an external non-condition arises by way of condition.

original: hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naajjhatto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum dhammam paṭicca na ajjhattaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With external condition as condition, an internal non-condition arises by way of condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.🔽Ajjhattaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nabahiddhā nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetuyā dve pe avigate dve  ajjhattam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na bahiddhā na na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With condition as two … with the unconditioned as two.🔽With internal non-condition as condition, an external non-non-condition arises by way of condition.

original: Bahiddhā nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naajjhatto nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: bahiddhā na hetum dhammam paṭicca na ajjhattaḥ na na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With external non-condition as condition, an internal non-non-condition arises by way of condition.

analyzed: saṅkhitta hetuyā dve pe avigate dve
translated: (Abbreviated.) With condition as two … with the unconditioned as two.
